Dating: LATE PERIOD (not before); GRAECO-ROMAN PERIOD (not after)
Name: Thoth standing with the head of an Ibis
Description: This small amulet which is part of the collection of E. Meester de Ravestein represents the god Thoth standing leaning against a dorsal pillar. The lord of  writing and the patron of scribes is presented most often as a man with the head of an Ibis. This object is distinguished by a suspension hole fixed between the dorsal pillar and the front part of the statue.
